Class Pad

java.lang.Object
  Pad

public class Pad
extends java.lang.Object

The Pad Class is used to represent individual lily pads in the pond. Each pad keeps track of its starting state and its current status (where each state is VACANT, TOAD, or FROG). Bugs: none known

Author:
Christopher Wilcox & Jacob Backhaus

Field Summary

          Symbolic constant representing a lily pad with a frog.

          Symbolic constant representing a lily pad with a toad.

          Symbolic constant representing a vacant lily pad (no toad and no frog).

VACANT

public static final int VACANT
Symbolic constant representing a vacant lily pad (no toad and no frog).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Pad

public Pad(int startState)
Creates a new lily pad with a given initial state (the state when the game begins). If the given state is invalid (not VACANT, TOAD, or FROG) then the constructor assumes that the intended status of the lily pad is VACANT.

Parameters:
startState - The Beginning State of the Pad
Method Detail

getStatus

public int getStatus()
Returns the current sate of the lily pad; must be VACANT, TOAD, or FROG.

Returns:
the current state of the lily pad

setStatus

public void setStatus(int status)
Changes the current state of lily pad. I fthe status is invalid (i.e., not VACANT, TOAD, or FROG), then the setStatus sets the status of the lily pad to VACANT.

Parameters:
status - The State of the Lily Pad

reset

public void reset()
This method restores the lily pad to the state it was in when originally constructed.

isSolved

public boolean isSolved()
Returns true if this lily pad is in the correct state for the solved puzzle and false otherwise.

Returns:
True if The Current State is the Solved State

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the string representation of the lily pad. This is used to display the lily pad on the console. It should return "#" for a TOAD lily pad, "%" for a FROG lily pad, and "O" (i.e., the upper-case letter that sounds like "oh") for a VACANT lily pad.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
